alert.note: Alert for Lee (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 03 at 11:01PM EDT until June 04 at 4:00AM EDT by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Florida, including the following county, Lee. * WHEN...Until 300 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1101 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated moderate to heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cape Coral, Fort Myers, Bonita Springs, Lehigh Acres, Cypress Lake, McGregor, Pine Manor, Villas, Harlem Heights, Iona, Lochmoor Waterway Estates, East Dunbar, San Carlos Park, Three Oaks, Palmona Park, Southwest Florida Airport, Lovers Key State Park, Matlacha Isles-Matlacha Shores, Matlacha and Buckingham. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
